column4: Teva to double production capacity in Japan - Nikkei
column5: June 27 Teva Pharmaceutical Industries Ltd   the world's biggest maker of generic medicines  is to spend about 20 billion yen ($203 million) to double its production capacity in Japan as the country looks to contain its healthcare costs  the Nikkei reported.

column4: Blackstone  Warburg among bidders for Carlyle's Arinc: sources
column5: NEW YORK Blackstone Group LP  and Warburg Pincus LLC are among the buyout firms through to the second round of the auction for Carlyle Group LP's  aerospace communications firm Arinc Inc  several people familiar with the matter said this week.

column4: Blackstone  Warburg among bidders for Carlyle's Arinc -sources
column5: NEW YORK  June 27 Blackstone Group LP and Warburg Pincus LLC are among the buyout firms through to the second round of the auction for Carlyle Group LP's  aerospace communications firm Arinc Inc  several people familiar with the matter said this week.

column4: De Beers CEO seeks slimmer  more flexible company
column5: TEL AVIV Diamond producer De Beers plans to cut costs and use machines more in place of labor as it strives to become leaner and more flexible in response to a tougher world economic environment  the company's chief executive said.

column4: TD Bank Group seeks to replace CIBC as Aeroplan partner
column5: TORONTO  June 27 TD Bank Group said on Thursday it has agreed to become the primary credit card issuer for Aeroplan  a loyalty program owned by Aimia  which could end rival CIBC's long-standing partnership with Aimia.

column4: UPDATE 1-U.S. Bank  partner to refund $6.5 mln over auto lending
column5: WASHINGTON  June 27 U.S. Bancorp's U.S. Bank and a nonbank partner will refund about $6.5 million to U.S. military personnel over auto lending practices regulators said were deceptive  the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau said on Thursday.

column4: Winnebago profit nearly doubles as economy picks up
column5: Winnebago Industries Inc  said its quarterly profit almost doubled in the important spring selling season as rising U.S. consumer confidence pushed up demand for its motor homes  offering further evidence of a strengthening U.S. economy.
